content:
• Tuesday, September 11, 2012
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) issues downbeat Q3 guidance , now expecting earnings to come in far...

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) issues downbeat Q3 guidance , now expecting earnings to come in far short of Street expectations due to reduced shipments and greater margin pressures from a flood of steel supply. The company now expects to earn between $0.09 - $0.14 per share. Street estimates were at $0.19 per share. Shares -4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN -5.9%) took a big hit today after noting in a filing yesterday that it doesn't...

    Amarin (AMRN -5.9%) took a big hit today after noting in a filing yesterday that it doesn't expect a decision from the FDA this month on the exclusivity of its heart pill Vascepa. This marks the second straight month a decision on Vascepa has failed to make the FDA's monthly "Orange Book" update. The ruling is a highly anticipated one that could award the company sole marketing rights to the drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 10 Comments
  • SNTS

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) says an advanced study of its investigational antibiotic Rifamycin SV MMX...

    Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) says an advanced study of its investigational antibiotic Rifamycin SV MMX met its primary endpoint in treating travelers' diarrhea. Shares +4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • MSFT

    More from Mark Zuckerberg: He once more claimed a Facebook phone doesn't make sense, in spite of...

    More from Mark Zuckerberg: He once more claimed a Facebook phone doesn't make sense, in spite of rumors (I, II) that it's building one. He also mentioned Facebook is handling 1B queries/day, and suggests Facebook will eventually build a search engine. Many have called on Facebook to enter the search market, and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) execs reportedly once floated the idea of selling Bing to Facebook, only to have Zuckerberg turn them down. Should Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) be worried? FB +3.2% AH. ZNGA +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 12 Comments
  • PCAR

    In its dividend announcement, Paccar (NASDAQ:PCAR) notes that Q3 truck production is expected to...

    In its dividend announcement, Paccar (NASDAQ:PCAR) notes that Q3 truck production is expected to be 15%-20% lower than Q2, reflecting build rate adjustments in North America and the normal two-week summer shutdown in Europe. Shares -1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) +2.2% AH as Mark Zuckerberg starts talking (video) at the TechCrunch...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) +2.2% AH as Mark Zuckerberg starts talking (video) at the TechCrunch Disrupt conference. Thus far, Zuck has tried to soothe concerns about mobile monetization, predicting Facebook will eventually make more money off mobile usage than PC usage. He also admits the company jumped the gun in embracing HTML5, something that was responsible for the sluggish performance of its mobile apps. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX) -25.4% AH after warning it expects FQ3 revenue of $271M-$276M, well below...

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX) -25.4% AH after warning it expects FQ3 revenue of $271M-$276M, well below a guidance range of $313M-$373M and a consensus of $344.6M. The company blames lower demand from enterprise storage OEM customers, as well as delayed sales for hard drive manufacturing and high-performance computing storage gear due to a failure to meet technical requirements. OEM customer NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) is down 2.6% AH. STX -1.2%. WDC -1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 2 Comments

  • Angie's List (ANGI +10.6%) steadily rallied to close with a big gain thanks to bullish comments...

    Angie's List (ANGI +10.6%) steadily rallied to close with a big gain thanks to bullish comments from Raymond James. The firm claims a merchant survey turned up positive sentiment about Angie's value as a marketing tool. Shares have been crushed in recent weeks by a lockup expiration and negative Street commentary.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • GCOM

    Globecomm Systems (NASDAQ:GCOM): FQ4 EPS of $0.13 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $104.8M (+18.8%...

    Globecomm Systems (NASDAQ:GCOM): FQ4 EPS of $0.13 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $104.8M (+18.8% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares -10.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • GSFVF

    Gasfrac's (OTC:GSFVF -14.6%) management shakeup, including the immediate departure of its CEO...

    Gasfrac's (OTC:GSFVF -14.6%) management shakeup, including the immediate departure of its CEO and COO, sends shares swooning. CFO Jim Hill will lead the company as president and CEO on an interim basis, and current operations personnel will assume COO duties. The oil and gas technology company also will undertake an operational review.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 18 Comments
  • QEP

    QEP Resources (QEP +3.4%) may be about to benefit more than investors have realized from its...

    QEP Resources (QEP +3.4%) may be about to benefit more than investors have realized from its shift away from natural gas and toward oil, BMO Capital says in initiating coverage with an Outperform rating. After its North Dakota purchase of 10,500 boe/day with reserves of 125M barrels at 81% oil, QEP is still gas-heavy but "that's beginning to change, perhaps quicker than the market anticipates."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • NEM

    The cheapest way for Newmont Mining (NEM +1.5%) to boost gold production is by finding new...

    The cheapest way for Newmont Mining (NEM +1.5%) to boost gold production is by finding new deposits and expanding its own assets instead of acquisitions, CEO Richard O'Brien says. The stalled Conga mine in Peru is "still in our plans," but there are other areas for expansion if it chooses to shelve the project, such as potential projects in Nevada, Australia, Indonesia and Ghana.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • COG

    Bernstein lists Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +5.2%), Southwestern Energy (SWN +4.6%) and Range...

    Bernstein lists Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +5.2%), Southwestern Energy (SWN +4.6%) and Range Resources (RRC +4.2%) as higher-growth mid-cap gas-levered names it believes will benefit from rising gas prices into 2013. Of the three, the firm notes COG has the highest-rate Marcellus wells, an achievable capital program, and compelling well results in the Eagle Ford.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +5.9%) is bouncing in the absence of major news; with shares still well below $5,...

    Groupon (GRPN +5.9%) is bouncing in the absence of major news; with shares still well below $5, the company's many shorts are free to book huge profits. Evercore's Ken Sena, who downgraded shares to Underweight last month, went on Bloomberg today (video) to discuss Groupon's dependence on up-front cash payments for daily deals billings to maintain positive cash flow, and the potential for cash flow to turn negative as billings drop. (CAO appointment)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLF

    Shares of coal (KOL +1.5%) and steel (SLX +2.3%) companies continue to rise after last week's...

    Shares of coal (KOL +1.5%) and steel (SLX +2.3%) companies continue to rise after last week's news that China would fast-track ~$150B in infrastructure spending plans. Investors hope China will soon announce another stimulus that will bolster demand for raw materials. Among today's top gainers: CLF +6.4%, ANR +6.1%, DNR +4.4%, X +4.2%, BTU +2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • NAVB

    ThinkEquity piles on to Navidea's (NAVB -27.4%) travails today, downgrading the shares to Hold...

    ThinkEquity piles on to Navidea's (NAVB -27.4%) travails today, downgrading the shares to Hold on the back of the FDA's rejection of its Lymphoseek application and lack any of visibility on the FDA's review process going forward. The firm also slashes its price target to $2.50 from $7.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +8.2%) surges after announcing the SM15000, a low-power server platform from its...

    AMD (AMD +8.2%) surges after announcing the SM15000, a low-power server platform from its SeaMicro division, which AMD acquired in February to much fanfare. Interestingly, the SM15000 supports both Intel Xeon and AMD Opteron CPUs. Thanks to SeaMicro's high-density server tech, a single server rack can house 256 CPUs, something that should go over well with Internet companies. The SM15000 can also connect to a storage cluster housing 5PB (5,000 TB) of data. (PRs: I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • BURBY

    Europe-based analysts see the selloff in Burberry (OTCPK:BURBY -19.0%) as a bit overdone in...

    Europe-based analysts see the selloff in Burberry (OTCPK:BURBY -19.0%) as a bit overdone in relation to the actual profit warning issued by the luxury-goods maker. To back their case, they note that a number of other European high-end sellers have been positive in the last weeks including LVMH (OTCPK:MAGOF 0.0%) which backed its H2 forecast. If they're on to something, luxury names on this side of the pond may have sold off a bit harshly off of Burberry-centric news: COH -1.9%, RL -2.9%, WRC -0.7%, KORS -1.9%, TIF -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • CDTI

    Shares of Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +11%) pop after Honda (HMC +0.6%) announces that...

    Shares of Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +11%) pop after Honda (HMC +0.6%) announces that it will begin selling its 2013 four and six-cylinder Accord models incorporating OTC:CDTI's palladium-only catalyst on September 19. The catalyst design significantly reduces precious metal content and cuts the use of Rhodium by 50%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +26.7%) is soaring in the absence of major news yet again today. Shares are...

    A123 Systems (AONE +26.7%) is soaring in the absence of major news yet again today. Shares are now up 50% on the week, though they're still changing hands at a paltry $0.30. It looks as if the shorts who control much of the electric car battery maker's float are booking some profits. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML +3.4%) jumps after announcing one of its touchscreen controllers is used in...

    Atmel (ATML +3.4%) jumps after announcing one of its touchscreen controllers is used in Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet. The Note 10.1, which tries to differentiate itself by offering a stylus and a split-screen mode, has received mixed reviews. And its $499 price tag puts it at clear disadvantage to cheaper hardware from Amazon, Lenovo, and others. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM

  • Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -4.3%) trade lower after a mid-morning volume spike that some...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -4.3%) trade lower after a mid-morning volume spike that some traders are attributing to a mini-flash crash. The bigger theme on the stock is that despite all the talk that the company is searching for a buyer, a bidding war doesn't seem to be breaking out which brings valuation and growth back into focus.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK +2%) agrees to sell ~57K net acres in the Eaglebine formation in Texas for $125M...

    Chesapeake (CHK +2%) agrees to sell ~57K net acres in the Eaglebine formation in Texas for $125M to emerging oil and gas producer Energy & Exploration Partners. CHK is in the process of divesting lots of oil and gas acreage to steady its financial ship and reduce its capital spending commitments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +2%) says it has started oil production at the Baleia Azul presalt field in the...

    Petrobras (PBR +2%) says it has started oil production at the Baleia Azul presalt field in the Campos Basin offshore Brazil. The first well at the field started pumping ~20K barrels of light crude oil late Monday to the Cidade de Anchieta FPSO vessel, one of several ordered by PBR to exploit Brazil's pre-salt riches. Output at the field is expected to peak at 100K bbl/day by Feb. 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • LM

    Investors cheer the departure of CEO Mark Fetting from Legg Mason (LM +5.6%) amid...

    Investors cheer the departure of CEO Mark Fetting from Legg Mason (LM +5.6%) amid indications he was given a push through the door. Taking over in January 2008, Fetting was effective at cutting costs, but it is felt different leadership is needed as the company turns its focus to growth, according to CFO Pete Nachtwey.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • SSRI

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +2%) reports intercepts from three target areas at its Pirquitas...

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +2%) reports intercepts from three target areas at its Pirquitas mine in Argentina contain significant silver and zinc mineralization. "Drill results demonstrate that the Cortaderas Breccia deposit extends beyond the eastern limits of the Inferred Mineral Resource reported last November," SSRI says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • NUVA

    Shares of Nuvasive (NUVA +2.3%) gain after an appeals court reverses an order by a lower court...

    Shares of Nuvasive (NUVA +2.3%) gain after an appeals court reverses an order by a lower court which forced the company to pay $60M to a competitor for trademark infringement. The lawsuit, filed by Neurovision Medical Products in September 2009, sought to cancel NuVasive's trademark on its nerve monitoring platform that carried it's name.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +3.0%) has been approached several times by potential acquirers, claims CEO Eyal...

    Mellanox (MLNX +3.0%) has been approached several times by potential acquirers, claims CEO Eyal Waldman, but the company prefers to remain independent. Waldman adds Mellanox has a "gentleman's agreement" with #1 customer Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) that the latter won't add to its 10% stake, whose value has increased considerably, and claims Mellanox's InfiniBand solutions won't see serious competition from rivals such as Intel for at least 3 years. Others are more concerned. (CFO retirement).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • BHP

    Deutsche Bank identifies a further $10B-$15B in assets BHP Billiton (BHP +2%) could sell...

    Deutsche Bank identifies a further $10B-$15B in assets BHP Billiton (BHP +2%) could sell that could allow the mining giant to fund its spending plans for high-returning growth projects such as U.S. shale, the Escondida and Spence mines in Chile, and loosening capacity bottlenecks in Australia's Pilbara iron ore operations. BHP raised $2.3B with two sales in the past two weeks alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM

  • Shares of DryShips (DRYS +7.8%) take another turn higher to reach their highest level since...

    Shares of DryShips (DRYS +7.8%) take another turn higher to reach their highest level since early July as they continue to significantly outperform the Baltic Dry Index (26.8% YTD vs -61.8%). It's been a bit of race against time for the company with growth and pricing prospects improving, but a debt load that still looks imposing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • VAR

    Varian Medical (VAR +0.8%) says China's State FDA has granted it clearance to market its Unique...

    Varian Medical (VAR +0.8%) says China's State FDA has granted it clearance to market its Unique Medical Linear Accelerator, a single-energy machine for treating cancer with advanced forms of image-guided radiotherapy. The system is used to deliver intensity-modulated radiotherapy and RapidArc treatments to precisely target tumors while minimizing exposure of surrounding healthy tissues.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • GOOG

    Qihoo (QIHU +4.8%) rises after CEO Zhou Hongyi claims his company's search engine will make use...

    Qihoo (QIHU +4.8%) rises after CEO Zhou Hongyi claims his company's search engine will make use of Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) ad system (presumably AdSense), and will launch an "open platform" for developers to provide better category-specific results. The latter sounds like a rival to Baidu's (NASDAQ:BIDU) popular Box Computing platform. Baidu shares have been pressured by Qihu's arrival on the Chinese search scene. The Google news shows how the company remains a key player in China's online ad market in spite of its search exit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM

  • Shares of Bon-Ton Stores (BONT +5.6%) head north to reach a 52-week high as investors continue...

    Shares of Bon-Ton Stores (BONT +5.6%) head north to reach a 52-week high as investors continue to bet on the firm's turnaround plan unveiled last week. At the moment, investors are overlooking a debt-to-capital ratio that's amongst the worst in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • IPI

    Intrepid Potash (IPI +1.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Wunderlich, which says demand is...

    Intrepid Potash (IPI +1.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Wunderlich, which says demand is growing over the long term. While the outlook for fertilizer demand this fall and next spring remains unclear as farmers across much of the U.S. grapple with ongoing drought conditions, the firm thinks increasing global demand should boost potash prices in the long term.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +32%) rockets higher this morning after announcing the initiation of its...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +32%) rockets higher this morning after announcing the initiation of its commercial launch of Pixuvri in the European Union. Pixuvri is a drug for the treatment of aggressive non-Hodgkin Lymphoma.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • HES

    Jim Cramer thinks asset sales could unlock big value for Hess (HES +2.4%); the company's assets...

    Jim Cramer thinks asset sales could unlock big value for Hess (HES +2.4%); the company's assets in the Bakken shale alone are worth $25/share, he says, while its Utica shale assets aren't valued at all. Internationally, its west Africa assets are worth $11, Europe $8 and Asia $17. Its New Jersey refining operation and 1,300 east coast filling stations could fetch another $2B, or $6/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (SYNC +2.7%) rallies after receiving an upgrade to Neutral from Citi. Citi had...

    Synacor (SYNC +2.7%) rallies after receiving an upgrade to Neutral from Citi. Citi had downgraded Synacor on June 1, when shares were well above current levels. BofA upgraded the provider of "TV Everywhere" software solutions on Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • LLIT

    Shares of Chinese medical homecare product developer Dehaier Medical (DHRM +55%) are soaring...

    Shares of Chinese medical homecare product developer Dehaier Medical (DHRM +55%) are soaring after the company says it's obtained Chinese State FDA approval for DHR-CPAP-C5, a device for the treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome. The device is one of DHRM's marquee proprietary products, and the approval is valid for the next four years.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM

  • Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -1.0%) trade lower after the firm takes on a harsh downgrade...

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -1.0%) trade lower after the firm takes on a harsh downgrade from Gabelli to Sell from Hold. The take from Gabelli analysts is that SIRI's 38% YTD run has outpaced fundamentals and investors should take profits now before Liberty Media stops buying shares with it almost at the magic 50% ownership mark.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +3.7%) jumps after reaching power purchase agreements with PG&E (NYSE:PCG)...

    First Solar (FSLR +3.7%) jumps after reaching power purchase agreements with PG&E (NYSE:PCG) for two California solar projects that will produce 72MW of electricity. The projects, which First Solar is looking to sell, could begin construction next year. Yesterday, First Solar announced its Agua Caliente solar project, for which the company was recently forced to halt module deliveries, now delivers 250MW of power to the grid.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • CALX

    Calix (CALX +8.4%) jumps on news CFO Michael Ashby bought 50K shares yesterday. The fiber...

    Calix (CALX +8.4%) jumps on news CFO Michael Ashby bought 50K shares yesterday. The fiber equipment firm has had a rough time dealing with a poor U.S. telecom capex environment. 11.3% of Calix's float was shorted as of Aug. 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • TIBX

    Tibco (TIBX -8.1%) tumbles on a downgrade to Hold from ThinkEquity's Yun Kim. Kim says his...

    Tibco (TIBX -8.1%) tumbles on a downgrade to Hold from ThinkEquity's Yun Kim. Kim says his checks indicate Tibco might be planning major job cuts, something that could have negative implications for the middleware vendor's growth and execution. Tibco's FQ3 report arrives on Sep. 20.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • CRTX

    FDA reviewer Nancy Xu says Cornerstone's (CRTX +5.3%) Lixivaptan drug should be approved to...

    FDA reviewer Nancy Xu says Cornerstone's (CRTX +5.3%) Lixivaptan drug should be approved to treat low sodium levels in the blood due to a condition that causes the body to have excess water. However, Xu says Lixivaptan shouldn't be authorized for heart-failure patients. An FDA advisory panel is due to meet on Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • TGH

    Textainer (NYSE:TGH) -3.7% premarket after announcing plans to offer up to 5M shares while...

    Textainer (NYSE:TGH) -3.7% premarket after announcing plans to offer up to 5M shares while shareholder Halco Holdings offers up to 2.5M shares; underwriters would have a 30-day option to buy up to another 15% in shares. Halco is affiliated with Trencor Ltd., TGH's largest shareholder with a ~60% stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are higher as data shows increased optimism among small-business...

    Market preview: Stock futures are higher as data shows increased optimism among small-business owners and a less-than-expected rise in the trade deficit. The S&P Benchmark is +0.3%. Luxury goods makers are getting hit after a profit warning from U.K. player Burberry and a downgrade on Coach. Later: Consumer Confidence
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • WSB

    Premarket gainers: WSB +91%. SNSS +48%. CTIC +15%. NOK +7%. CRTX +7%. RBS +6%. PSTI +5%. Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: WSB +91%. SNSS +48%. CTIC +15%. NOK +7%. CRTX +7%. RBS +6%. PSTI +5%.
    Losers: NAVB -31%. PPO -12%. PANW -8%. SQNM -7%. PPHM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • WSB

    The consolidation of the community banking sector (at least in Maryland) continues with WSB...

    The consolidation of the community banking sector (at least in Maryland) continues with WSB Holdings (NASDAQ:WSB) +97% premarket after its purchase by Old Line Bancshares (NASDAQ:OLBK) for $49M in cash and stock. The combined banks will have assets of $1.2B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • SNSS

    Sunesis (NASDAQ:SNSS) rockets 53% after saying that it's increasing the size of its Phase 3...

    Sunesis (NASDAQ:SNSS) rockets 53% after saying that it's increasing the size of its Phase 3 trial for its Vosaroxin leukemia drug by 225 patients to 675. The move follows a recommendation by the study's independent Data & Safety Monitoring Board following its interim analysis of trial data. The recommendation triggers an obligation of Royalty Pharma to invest $25M in Sunesis. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • BURBY

    The double whammy of a downgrade on Coach and a biting profit warning from British luxury player...

    The double whammy of a downgrade on Coach and a biting profit warning from British luxury player Burberry (OTCPK:BURBY)  is cutting a wide swath of selling in the sector. Though some of Burberry's struggles are pegged as "self-afflicted," the company's weakening sales in Europe and China has to be considered alarming for high-end sellers. Premarket: COH -3.4%, RL -2.7%, WRC -0.7%, KORS -1.2%,, TIF -2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • EOX

    Emerald Oil (NYSEMKT:EOX), which recently changed its name from Voyager Oil & Gas...

    Emerald Oil (NYSEMKT:EOX), which recently changed its name from Voyager Oil & Gas (VOG), -11.8% premarket after announcing it is offering 82M shares to raise funds to repay debt. The E&P company had 70.1M shares outstanding as of Aug. 6.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • EPB

    El Paso Pipeline Partners (NYSE:EPB) -4.1% premarket after an SEC filing reveals it has...

    El Paso Pipeline Partners (NYSE:EPB) -4.1% premarket after an SEC filing reveals it has commenced an offering of 7.1M units at $34.34 each, representing limited partner interests. Net proceeds will be used to repay debt and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • CMO

    Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) declares $0.36/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record...

    Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) declares $0.36/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record Sep 28. Payable Oct 19. Ex-div date Sep 26. Shares -2.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • PPO

    Polypore (NYSE:PPO) -13.5% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q3 and Q4, seeing Q3...

    Polypore (NYSE:PPO) -13.5% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q3 and Q4, seeing Q3 EPS in the low to mid-$0.30 range vs. $0.49 analyst consensus, and seeing Q4 EPS in the low $0.50 to low $0.60 range vs. $0.61 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) gain 3.4% premarket to $31.40 as more...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) gain 3.4% premarket to $31.40 as more momentum builds with Luigi Lavazza upping its stake. The Italian coffee firm now holds a 6.8% stake in GMCR.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank's co-CEOs unveil their plans to deliver return to shareholders in a lousy macro...

    Deutsche Bank's co-CEOs unveil their plans to deliver return to shareholders in a lousy macro environment for investment banking, promising €4.5B in annual savings by 2015 - greater than the €3B floated 2 months ago. No report is made on whether the two will take down bank leverage. It's TBTF on steroids in Germany, where DB's assets exceed Tier 1 capital by more than 40X. Shares +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 AM

  • European shares are lower in early trading on concerns that Germany's Constitutional Court will...

    European shares are lower in early trading on concerns that Germany's Constitutional Court will attach lots of strings to the ESM when it rules on the legality of the eurozone rescue fund tomorrow. The mood is also dampened by concerns that the Fed won't announce more money printing this week. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.5%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.7%, Frankfurt -0.1%, Madrid -1.1%, Milan -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 AM | 6 Comments

  • Asian shares are mixed as investors position themselves for a German court decision tomorrow on...

    Asian shares are mixed as investors position themselves for a German court decision tomorrow on the legality of the ESM and the start of the FOMC's two-day meeting. Japan -0.7%, Hong Kong +0.2%, China -0.7%, India +0.3%.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 AM
